overview:
Steve Gotz has over 10 years of experience commercializing technology and service offerings in both large corporate intrapreneurial environments (AT&T Labs) as well as small entrepreneurial ventures. Currently he serves as Commercial Development Manager for CNGL, a â‚¬33M Science Foundation Ireland funded research group, where he is responsible for portfolio management and commercialisation of intellectual property arising from research activities. Previously he served as a consultant for firms in Hong Kong, the U.S. and U.K. seeking to establish operating divisions and extend their product lines within the Mainland China market.

In 1999 he co-founded DigitalHound, LLC, a software company which developed digital fingerprinting technology that allowed the entertainment industry to track and enforce intellectual property rights onilne. The company was selected as one of the top start-ups in NYC by the New York New Media Association and presented at the 2000 Venture Downtown. The company was acquired for an undisclosed sum in August 2000 by iCopyright.com of Renton, WA.
